alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Cumberland; Lunenburg; Nottoway; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Cumberland, Prince Edward, northern Lunenburg, Nottoway and Amelia Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 414 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Prospect, or 10 miles northwest of Hampden Sydney, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Farmville, Blackstone, Crewe, Victoria, Kenbridge, Amelia Courthouse, Mannboro, Hampden Sydney, Hampden Sydney College, Longwood University, Nottoway, Lunenburg, Burkeville, Guinea Mills, Darlington Heights, Morven, Spainville, Green Bay, Jetersville and Scotts Fork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Cumberland; Lunenburg; Nottoway; Prince Edward
